intro: Bupleurum ferganense, commonly known as the Fergana bellflower, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental value. Bupleurum ferganense is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its potential medicinal properties.
